discussion.content: C is the correct answer

Selected Answer: C
Reference answer on FortiManager_7.2_Study_Guide Pg 241
Answer - C

choices.A: Set to normal and using the approval group feature
choices.C: Set to workflow and using the ADOM locking feature
choices.D: Set to workspace and using the policy locking feature
choices.B: Set to read/write and using the policy locking feature

questions.question_text:
An administrator would like to review, approve or reject all the firewall policy changes made by the junior administrators.
How should the workspace mode settings be configured on FortiManager?

discussion.content: BC is the correct answer

Selected Answer: BC
Remote FortiGate Directly (through the CLI): A script can be executed directly on the device and you don’t need to install the changes using the installation wizard. As the changes are directly installed on the managed device, no option is provided to verify and check the configuration changes through FortiManager prior to executing it.

Selected Answer: BC
When running a script with the option Remote FortiGate Directly (through the CLI) it will be executed directly on the device.

A. Wrong. No option is provided to preview the configuration changes through FortiManager prior to executing it.
B. Correct
C. Correct
D. Wrong. Don’t need to install the changes using the installation wizard

Answer - B, C 
FMG 7.2 pages -188

choices.C: FortiGate will auto-update the FortiManager device-level database.
choices.A: FortiManager provides a preview of CLI commands before executing this script on a managed FortiGate.
choices.B: FortiManager will create a new revision history.
choices.D: You must install these changes using the Install Wizard.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In FortiGate Fabric Connectors \ Security Fabric Settings we can enable how to serve the Fabric Root or Join existing fabric. Then we need to join the FGT in Fortianalyzer.

Selected Answer: B
A. wrong you do not move devices across ADOMs using that add device
B. Correct as all the rest are wrong
C. Doesnt make sense
D. wrong. to Add a device you have to be an ADOM. Added automatically doesnt make sense

B may be correct, but the question is wrongly asked.
The device will be added to whatever ADOM you are currently in. So if the device was added by securtiy fabric in root ADOM, the device will be added to that ADOM. If it was added from the training ADOM, it will be added to that ADOM.

The question was only about that authorization is on FortiManager - not which ADOM
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
When a device is authorized and ADOMs are enabled, the device appears in the root ADOM.

questions.question_text:
In addition to the default ADOMs, an administrator has created a new ADOM named Training for FortiGate devices only. The administrator authorized the FortiGate device on FortiManager using the Fortinet Security Fabric.
Given the administrator’s actions, which statement correctly describes the expected result?

choices.C: The authorized FortiGate can be added to the Training ADOM using FortiGate Fabric Connectors.
choices.D: The authorized FortiGate will be automatically added to the Training ADOM.
choices.B: The authorized FortiGate will appear in the root ADOM.
choices.A: The FortiManager administrator must add the authorized device to the Training ADOM using the Add Device wizard only.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In manual mode, when a failure of the secondary occurs, the administrator can reconfigure the primary device to remove the failed secondary configuration.

A. Wrong. That'd be the VRRP (automatic) failover mode.
B. Wrong. That is more related to a primary failure, not secondary.
C. Correct.
D. Wrong. Rebooting the failed device won't remove its IP from the primary.
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: C
If the secondary FortiManager fails, you can:
- Reconfigure the primary device to remove the peer IP of the failed secondary device
- Leave the configuration so that when the secondary device comes online, it can resynchronize with the promary.

Selected Answer: C
page 330
If the secondary FortiManager fails, the administrator can reconfigure the primary device to remove the secondary configuration.
C is the correct answer
Correct answer is C
Correct answer is C, FM study guide p.330

choices.D: Reboot the failed device to remove its IP from the primary device.
choices.C: Reconfigure the primary device to remove the peer IP of the failed device.
choices.A: The FortiManager HA state transition is transparent to administrators and does not require any reconfiguration.
choices.B: Manually promote one of the working secondary devices to the primary role, and reboot the old primary device to remove the peer IP of the failed device.

questions.question_text: In the event that one of the secondary FortiManager devices fails, which action must be performed to return the FortiManager HA manual mode to a working state?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
C & D are Wrong - Management Extensions are disabled by default (page 267) and the fortimanager setup wizard appears once you login to the FM for first time therefore A,B and E are correct
ABE is the correct answer

Selected Answer: ABE
Management Extension apps are disabled in the FortiManager default configuration and when you log in to FortiManager for the first time the setup wizard displays.

choices.D: The FortiManager setup wizard is disabled.
choices.B: The Port1 interface IP address is 192.168.1.99/24.

questions.question_text: Which three settings are the factory default settings on FortiManager? (Choose three.)
